In New York, a 5-alarm fire at a Bronx deli, a recall of radioactive shrimp, and a surge in flu cases prompt renewed mask mandates in hospitals, while the city also sees significant housing and legislative developments as it prepares for a challenging 2026.

### Risks & Alerts

- Fire crews battle 5-alarm fire at Bronx deli, impacting nearby businesses. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiekFVX3lxTFB2cnRfQ3dDd0RhRTZnNmdZVjNkQmlLVHFMNGY0R2xOVE1Xc1Nwdm9sREpTZ0pITHhPUjZRNDhCWWk5cmkwOS1VOXNOUVFjQUZmMEFwUXhfWVRKUTRTTXcwU3lKZkhzRlZYWTVQWmhOUkVsZ0tVenVkM1pB0gF_QVVfeXFMTjJqUG1uVHNUdTQyZmIwV0JRMTlZclV4dHRvVjJKMnZzMGFqOTItaGJ5TlBzYnFXUEhjOFpwYzQxSXpVb0Vwa25SNjVXdVhVWlJOZzNVSXhPUFR6a0xkOEFUNXVzbEY1VmF1aXQ2bE5tVkg0TVhFOUYzc0VEbE43aw?oc=5)
- FDA recalls radioactive shrimp, including products sold in New York. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Masks are required again in New York hospitals due to a 'super flu' outbreak. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- NYC experiences a spike in flu cases as 2026 begins, affecting public health. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiYEFVX3lxTE02QUV0eXo1WG1fdGtKOTNRazdPdlh6ejZpV2lOSG9RZmtTclFMUkNKZDQxMThwc2pUcW1RNUFaM0duc0pjdEotZmN1dkJBdEJSVTVsc3VQNnlhM3NGaWd6Qw?oc=5)
